title: Pikachu wasn’t the original mascot
fact: Initially, the creators considered Clefairy and Poliwhirl as the franchise’s mascot before settling on Pikachu due to its popularity and gender-neutral appeal.

title: Pokémon’s name origin
fact: The name “Pokémon” is a contraction of Pocket Monsters.

title: The creator’s inspiration
fact: Satoshi Tajiri, the creator of Pokémon, was inspired by his childhood hobby of insect collecting.

title: Guinness World Record
fact: Several Pokémon characters hold Guinness World Records, including Pikachu for being featured on legal tender currency.

title: Pikachu’s design inspiration
fact: Pikachu was designed after a squirrel, not a mouse.

title: Pokémon manhole covers
fact: In Japan, there are Pokémon-themed manhole covers called “Pokéfuta” that feature various Pokémon designs.

title: Slowbro’s unique trait
fact: Slowbro is one of the few Pokémon that can potentially devolve, reverting back to its previous form.

title: Pokémon Go’s massive success
fact: The mobile game Pokémon Go has been downloaded over 1 billion times, making it one of the most downloaded mobile games ever.

title: Over 1000 species
fact: As of now, there are over 1000 different species of Pokémon.

title: Rhydon was the first Pokémon ever created
fact: Despite not being the first in the Pokédex, Rhydon holds the title of the first Pokémon designed.
